24.title: Geographical search (centre on coordinates)
24.text: If coordinates of a point of interest are known, these can simply be entered in the “Search location, zip, coordinate” field, to centre the map on the required point: for example "600000 200000" in national coordinates or "46.5 6.0" for latitiude and longitude

25.title: Geographical search (place name or postcode)
25.text: The “Search location, zip, coordinate” field enables direct access to any place or commune name, any Swiss postcode or indeed any location named on the national map at any scale (mountain, valley, pass, hamlet, farmhouse, hut, river, stream, lake, etc.) As soon as a letter or number is entered, suggestions for place names or postcodes respectively will start to appear; if the desired name or postcode becomes visible it is then sufficient to click on it.

28.title: 2.5D / (3D ALPHA)
28.text:
The viewer can also be activated in 2.5D / 3D mode. You can put all 2D data on the terrain model - with probable distortions for some areas. To enable this feature, the 2.5D button must be activated. Data can be added via the search or the catalog.

IMPORTANT: This feature is available in an alpha version, as an early stage of development. The availability of version alpha can not be guaranteed - they can be deactivated under certain circumstances.



Tilt up/down
PC + Mac: Shift or CTRL or ALT + left mouse button + drag up / down
Touch:
Tilts the viewer toward "horizon" / "top-down" view.

Look
PC: CTRL + left mouse button + drag
Mac: Command/Open Apple Key + mouse button + drag
Touch:
Perspective points in another direction, as if you are turning your head up, down, left or right.

Zoom in/Zoom out
PC + Mac: Scroll wheel or right mouse + drag up / down
Touch:
Zooms the viewer in and out.

Move left / right
PC + Mac: Left / right arrow
Touch: One finger drag left / right

Move forward / backward
PC + Mac: Up / down arrow
Touch: One finger drag forward / backward

31.title: Full text search for data
31.text: Under "Search" you can enter search terms (keywords such as marsh, road, commune, earthquake) in order to search through all centrally available digital geodata. When you select one of the results offered, it will be displayed on the map viewer, as a separate data layer

32.title: Search for data (catalogue)
32.text: Under "Change topic" you will find all available digital data classified by theme. When you select a data-set (by clicking on the circle symbol to the right) it will be displayed directly by the map viewer, as a separate layer of data.

34.title: Change the visibility of the selected dataset
34.text: Click the Icon (1). The transparency/opacity of each selected data-set (layer) can be individually adjusted by activating the layer options and the changing the horizontal slider. Options menu can then be hidden again if required.

35.title: Change the order of the selected datasets
35.text: Click the Icon (1). The order of the selected data-sets (layers) can be changed by using the up or down arrows (2) in the “selection” pane.

36.title: Remove selected datasets
36.text: A selected data-set (layer) can be removed from the “Selection” list and from the map itself by using the “Remove layer” (Close) button (1).

37.title: View additional information about a data-set
37.text: In the “Selection”, “Search” or “Catalogue” pane, the “i” button provides access to an information window about the selected data-set (layer). The information provided covers; the range of applicable scales, available metadata, a link to the description of the data, how to order data, the relevant thematic geoportal and WMS service and the issue date (latest revision date) of the data.

39.title: Datenbezug
39.text: Die Daten, die im Kartenfenster angezeigt werden, können, falls vom entsprechenden BA vorgesehen direkt bei deisem bezogen werden. Über den info Knopf wird das Info Fenster zu einem ausgewähltem Datensatz geöffnet. Der Link Datenbezug führt zur jeweiligen Bezugsstelle.

44.title: How to select objects « Query Tool »
44.text:
1. Choose a dataset from the topic « Aviation » (e.g. Air navigation obstacles). All datasets whose attributes are searchable, can be used in this tool. Here’s an overview of those datasets.
  2. Choose « Object information » from the « Tools » section
  3. To select all objects (200 as a maximum!) inside a map perimeter, use CTRL (cmd on Mac) and draw a rectangle on the map



    4. Select objects by attributes with types date or numeric

  4. Objects can be searched by predefined or user defined queries
  5. Set the query parameters by choosing a dataset,
  6. an attribute, an operator,
  7. and by entering a value (numeric or date).
  8. Several queries can be combined with an AND operation.

    9. Finish your query by clicking « Search ». The objects corresponding to the query are highlighted in the map and appear inside the result list. A maximum of 200 objects can be selected.



    Select objects by attributes with type domain
    It is possible to search by attributes with domain values (e.g. the status of Air navigation obstacles).

  9. Choose the attribute « Status » from the dropdown menu
  10. Click here in order to display all occurring values of the attribute
  11. Choose operator « ilike » = or « not ilike » !=
Finish your query by clicking « Search ». The objects corresponding to the query are highlighted in the map and appear inside the result list. A maximum of 200 objects can be selected.

62.title: WMS import
62.text: Only WMS services compliant with "Swiss Projection EPSG 21781" and following the WMS OGC Standard can be displayed. An easy tool to check this is provided by Link Generally the WMS datasets are visible in a given scale, that's why the right portion of the map has to be selected and appropriate scale too. The displaying speed of WMS datasets and their availability is under responsibility of the service owner. The WMS datasets can be saved as PDF through the "Print" function. A WMS dataset can be forwarded by email with Permalink "Link" function. Please, follow the use conditions of the WMS service provider.

63.title: KML import
63.text:
It is now possible to display KML saved online (by using URL) or locally (this fonction is not possible with IE)

Only KML files without any error can be displayed. These files must be compliant with the OGC KML format

An easy way to check your file is provided by Link



Generating KML file and using it online

How to create a .kml file

Online KML Generator
Drawing

How to publish a .kml file online
In order to distribute your own KML-files via a stable URL without setting up an own web server you can use the following free services for hosting and distributing:

1. Publish with Google Docs

  • Create your account: https://docs.google.com
  • Upload the file: click on the Upload button > Files…
  • In the window "File Upload" select your KML file and "Open"
  • In the window "Upload settings "Uncheck "Convert documents, presentations, spreadsheets, and drawings to the corresponding Google Docs format" and "Convert text from PDF and image files to Google documents" and click "Start upload"
  • Select the document by clicking in the checkbox on the left and click on the share button and then on "Change…" in the "Sharing settings" widows. Select "Public on the web" or "Anyone with the link" and click "Save", copy the "Link to share" then "Done".
  • Modify the copied Link by changing the word "leaf" by "uc" between "https://docs.google.com/" and "?id=…", the link can be use in the "KML import" in map.geo.admin.ch

Example:
//map.geo.admin.ch/?Y=600769&X=198300.5&zoom=7&bgOpacity=0&bgLayer=ch.swisstopo.pixelkarte-grau&layers=KML%7C%7Chttps%3A%2F%2Fdocs.google.com%2Fuc%3Fid%3D0B4uRuJ1hajZmZjJlZDNiMGItNmU0Zi00N2FlLWJiZDItM2UwZDA3YmQwYzk3%26hl%3Dfr&layers_opacity=1&layers_visibility=true

2. Publish with Dropbox

  • Create your account: http://www.dropbox.com (You can install it or only use the web interface on this website)
  • Move your KML File in the public folder once the file is in your Public folder, simply right-click it once to open a menu. Choose "Dropbox > Copy public link" (Dropbox installed on your computer) or "Copy public link" (Web interface).(More information about Shared document in Dropbox: http://www.dropbox.com/help/16
  • Modify the copied Link by adding "dl=1": http://dl.dropbox.com/u/44486020/swisstopo.kml?dl=1.
  • The link can be used in the "KML import" in map.geo.admin.ch

Example:
//map.geo.admin.ch/?Y=600769&X=198300.5&zoom=7&bgOpacity=0&bgLayer=ch.swisstopo.pixelkarte-grau&layers=KML%7C%7Chttp%3A%2F%2Fdl.dropbox.com%2Fu%2F44486020%2Fswisstopo.kml&layers_opacity=1&layers_visibility=true

3. Publish with Gist

Gist, a feature made available by Github

  • Drag your KML-file into the text field of Gist (1). After that, the code of the KML-file is visible in the text field
  • Push “Create Public Gist” (2)
  • Push “Raw” (3)
  • As visible in (4), an URL with your KML-file has been generated
  • According to (5) you can now embed the KML-file via the URL in the map viewer. In addition you can create map.geo.admin.ch-permalinks with your KML and share your data with other users or on your own web page.

66.title: All "draw/measure" functions
66.text:
1- Add symbol
2- Add text
3- Add line / polygon
4- Measure
5- Share drawing / KML

68.title: Object information
68.text: To get informations on several obects, trace a recangle with CTRL+ mouse click, all objects included in the rectangle will be collected in a single information window:

70.title: Report problem
70.text:
This tool enables you to send suggestions on map.geo.admin.ch. We welcome problem reports as well as general comments.
Open map.geo.admin.ch and zoom in an area of interest: a street, an address, a place. Use the search tool to directly search your area of interest. Click top-right on "Report problem".

Your e-mail
Fill in the field with your e-mail address. The field is not mandatory.

Your feedback to the current map extent
Fill in with your comments or problem report.

Your drawing
You can additionally provide a drawing by using the drawing tools. The drawing will be automatically attached to the report. This section is not mandatory.

Attach a file
You can provide additional information by attaching a file ("Browse"). This section is not mandatory.

Click "Send"

What file formats can be attached?
The following formats are supported: .pdf, .zip, .jpg, .jpeg, .kml, .kmz oder gpx.

What happens to my report?
In case of problems related to data, the information will be forwarded to the respective data owner.
